name: RGeo::GeoJSON
body:
[RGeo](http://dazuma.github.com/rgeo) is a key component for writing location-aware applications in the Ruby programming language. At its core is an implementation of the industry standard OGC Simple Features Specification, which provides data representations of geometric objects such as points, lines, and polygons, along with a set of geometric analysis operation.

RGeo::GeoJSON is an optional RGeo add-on module that provides GeoJSON encoding and decoding services. GeoJSON is an emerging standard format used by many web services that need to communicate geospatial data. See [www.geojson.com](http://www.geojson.com/) for more information.

Example:

```ruby
require 'rgeo/geo_json'

str1 = '{"type":"Point","coordinates":[1,2]}'
geom = RGeo::GeoJSON.decode(str1, :json_parser => :json)
geom.as_text              # => "POINT(1.0 2.0)"
 
str2 = '{"type":"Feature","geometry":{"type":"Point","coordinates":[2.5,4.0]},"properties":{"color":"red"}}'
feature = RGeo::GeoJSON.decode(str2, :json_parser => :json)
feature['color']          # => 'red'
feature.geometry.as_text  # => "POINT(2.5 4.0)"
 
hash = RGeo::GeoJSON.encode(feature)
hash.to_json == str2      # => true
```

For more information:

* See the [documentation](http://dazuma.github.com/rgeo-geojson/rdoc)
* Source code on [Github](http://github.com/dazuma/rgeo-geojson)
* Report issues [here](http://github.com/dazuma/rgeo-geojson/issues)
* Questions? Ask on the [mailing list](http://groups.google.com/group/rgeo-users)
